**Relevant Ghanaian  legal/regulatory/policy/institutional frameworks which recognize and protect access rights for small-scale fisheries**

We have identified the following policies, plans and legislations that promote the development of the fisheries sector including the small-scale sector where majority of the Ghanaian fisher-folks work. 

- [Co-Management Policy for the Fisheries Sector, 2020](https://www.crc.uri.edu/download/GH2014_POL112_MOFAD_FIN508.pdf)

- [Fisheries Management Plan, 2015 - 2019](https://mofad.gov.gh/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/FISHERIES-MANAGEMENT-PLAN-OF-GHANA.pdf)

- [Fisheries Act, 2002 (Act No. 625 of 2002)](https://www.mofad.gov.gh/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/Fisheries-Act-2002-Act-625.pdf)

- [Fisheries (Amendment) Act, 2014 (Act No. 880)](https://mofad.gov.gh/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/FISHERIES-AMENDMENTACT2014.pdf)

- [Fisheries (Amendment) Regulations 2015 (L.I. 2217)](https://mofad.gov.gh/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/FISHERIES-AMENDMENT-REGULATIONS-2015-L.I.-2217.pdf)

- A dedicated Ministry responsible for [Fisheries and Aquaculture Development](https://mofad.gov.gh) was created in 2017.
